title: Tanker Seizure Forces Chevron to Slash Prices on Venezuelan Crude
summary: Chevron has quietly cut the price of Venezuelan crude sold to U.S. refiners after American forces seized a tanker off the country’s coast, tightening an already-fragile export channel and adding fresh volatility to Gulf Coast markets. title: Europe Under Siege as Moscow Targets Critical Infrastructure
summary: What looked at first like a bizarre local accident in western Norway should have set off every alarm bell in Europe. title: LNG Supply Expands Faster Than China’s Demand Growth
summary: China’s LNG demand is disappointing in 2025 for a second year in a row, just as new U.S. export projects ramp up and Qatar is nearing start-up of the first new facilities in its huge capacity expansion. title: IEA: Coal Outpaces Gas in OECD Power Mix as "Bridge Fuel" Falters

title: The Real Reason Behind U.S. Resuming Iraqi Kurdistan Oil Imports
